str2: Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
From heaven, from the sky. From ouranos and the enclitic of source; from the sky.
Splendor, brightness, brilliancy. From lampros; brilliancy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To shine around. From peri and lampo; to illuminate all around, i.e. Invest with a halo.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
